channel.title: .cfg files missing when running server on CentOS VPS? Help!
channel.description:
[b]I have a new problem![/b]
I learned how to run the server, though when I do, I receive an error saying that some .cfg files cannot be found. I've spent at least an hour searching Google for solutions but I've yet to find one. Some threads were even posted here on Moparscape and still, nothing. Does anyone have any advice?
I type in sh run.sh and it tells me...
item.cfg: file missing shops.cfg: file missing
etc..
Any advice?

item.title: .cfg files missing when running server on CentOS VPS? Help!
item.dc:creator: @Amayzing Amayzing
item.description:
@Amayzing wrote:

deathschaos9:

Yes you need to change all instances of it in every file you find.

Do you think there are any other files aside from the *handlers.java?

Edit: I edited all of the config\ to config/ in item.cfg and placed it into the config folder and received the same error. :\

Read full topic

item.title: .cfg files missing when running server on CentOS VPS? Help!
item.dc:creator: @Amayzing Amayzing
item.description:
@Amayzing wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:12, topic:351537”]You need to fix it for every cfg file thats not loading.
ShopHandler
ItemHandler
NPCHandler
MagicHandler
Client
DoorHandler

Just look for:
config//
and you should be able to find everything.[/quote]

Where do I find them though? In the “handler” like that other member mentioned?

I apologize but I’m a newb, I’m basically just getting started when it comes to RSPS, lol.

item.title: .cfg files missing when running server on CentOS VPS? Help!
item.dc:creator: @Amayzing Amayzing
item.description:
@Amayzing wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:10, topic:351537”]You actually just have to set the path to the file correctly, for example
Currently:
new FileReader(“config\” + FileName));
Should be:
new FileReader(“config/” + FileName));
The path should be one forward slash, that’s it. No fancy // or \ or ./ or anything like that.[/quote]

And I can find that where?

Read full topic
item.source: .cfg files missing when running server on CentOS VPS? Help!

item.title: .cfg files missing when running server on CentOS VPS? Help!
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

You actually just have to set the path to the file correctly, for example
Currently:
new FileReader(“config\” + FileName));
Should be:
new FileReader(“config/” + FileName));
The path should be one forward slash, that’s it. No fancy // or \ or ./ or anything like that.

Read full topic
item.source: .cfg files missing when running server on CentOS VPS? Help!

item.title: .cfg files missing when running server on CentOS VPS? Help!
item.dc:creator: @mrjad mrjad
item.description:
@mrjad wrote:

u guys are all idiots above, what you do is you open up the handler for the cfg for

for example for shops .cfg, go into shophandler.java and search for loadshops, you should see a directory thats says like config//+filename+ make it only say filename, then put shops.cfg into your server folder, instead of config folder

Read full topic

item.title: .cfg files missing when running server on CentOS VPS? Help!
item.dc:creator: @Amayzing Amayzing
item.description:
@Amayzing wrote:

I’ve done all of that and it seems to be working except for one error…

Whenever I type sh run.sh in the terminal, I receive an error saying some .cfg files cannot be found.

shops.cfg
items.cfg
autospawn.cfg

etc…

I’ve searched all over Google and found similar problems that were posted here on MS but no solutions.

Any help?

Read full topic
item.source: .cfg files missing when running server on CentOS VPS? Help!

item.title: .cfg files missing when running server on CentOS VPS? Help!
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Okay, make a new shell script file (right click new file… new text file) save as run.sh, open that file with KWrite. And add the following

java -Xmx520m Server
You can edit the 520 your desired java heap allowed.
Than open a new terminal in the same folder and type
sh run.sh
And it should work, if not, make small adjustments (Right path to Server class, making sure its lowercase/uppercase)

Read full topic
item.source: .cfg files missing when running server on CentOS VPS? Help!

item.description:
@Amayzing wrote:

Infinity Zr:

To start a likeable server use a packaged server aka shards, or a blank sources it really better yo write your own stuff the use other peoples…

I planned on using Creativescape since it’s apparently Shards and that’s how you learn.

Though, all I’m trying to do right now is learn how to get the server online with CentOS.

item.title: .cfg files missing when running server on CentOS VPS? Help!
item.dc:creator: @Amayzing Amayzing
item.description:
@Amayzing wrote:

[quote=“iCreatedHorror, post:2, topic:351537”]Uhhh yes, it’s called The Search Button.
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,429240.msg3151495.html#msg3151495[/quote]

Are you stupid?

That tutorial shows nothing other than connecting to your VPS using remote desktop connection.

I had install UltraVNC myself which is a program like remote desktop connection for Linux servers. That’s basically a tutorial for people who own a Windows VPS which is 500,000 times different than any type of Linux VPS. Again, CentOS and Windows are two completely different things.

If you don’t have any useful information, please don’t post pure stupidity, it only makes you look bad.[quote=“deathschaos9, post:3, topic:351537”][quote author=iCreatedHorror link=topic=447893.msg3287146#msg3287146 date=1280271112]
Uhhh yes, it’s called The Search Button.
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,429240.msg3151495.html#msg3151495
[/quote]
That is for a windows vps.

Amayzing, you use the terminal + shell scripts to run your server
Is your server packaged? Or are all the java and class files in the same folder?[/quote]

I assumed I’d be using the terminal, I was just unaware of what I specifically needed to do.

And no, the server isn’t really packaged, .java and .class files are flying everywhere.

Read full topic
